snippet: Masked men shoved Russian opposition leader Leonid Razvozzhayev into a van, outside the office of his lawyer in Kiev.
abstract: Abduction of Leonid Razvozzhayev, little-known leader of Russian political opposition, in Kiev, Ukraine, showcases Kremlin's willingness to employ aggressive, even illegal, measures to suppress political critics of Pres Vladimir V Putin; abduction also fits pattern of cases in which people seeking protection in Ukraine were instead returned to countries they fled, in violation of Ukrainian law as well as international laws and treaties that protect asylum seekers.
lead_paragraph: Masked men shoved Russian opposition leader Leonid Razvozzhayev into a van, outside the office of his lawyer in Kiev.

headline.seo: Abduction of Razvozzhayev Shines Light on Ukraine and Kremlin Methods
headline.main: An Abduction Shines Light on Ukraine Asylum Policy and on Kremlin Methods
headline.print_headline: An Abduction Shines Light On Ukraine Asylum Policy And on Kremlin Methods
